Description: Rim and wall sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed; white line at rim, red band lined in white on mid-wall; exterior slipped cream: tongues between dilute lines at rim; below, handle spiral with leaves on the right, elaborate and large rosette central and below left the incised tail of a bird.
Curator's comments: Compare M.C. Lentini (ed.), Vasi del Wild Goat Style dalla Sicilia e dai Musei Europei, Catalogo della Mostra, Gela - Bochum 2006, 105 no. 40: analysed by H. Mommsen with NAA, attributed to group B (Teos).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 243, no. 249)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1160)
